text: A blazing-fast, multi-threaded file search utility written in C. It is designed
to be a powerful replacement for traditional 'find' commands, with a focus on
performance, rich filtering, and flexible output formats.
[cyan]<directory>[/]             Directory to start searching from (Default: current directory).
[green]-p, --pattern <regex>[/]   [bold](Required)[/] POSIX extended regular expression to match filenames.
[bold]By Metadata:[/b]
[green]-t, --type <f|d|l>[/]        Filter by type: [cyan]f[/]ile, [cyan]d[/]irectory, or symbolic [cyan]l[/]ink.
[green]--size <[+|-]N[K|M|G]>[/]  Filter by size (e.g., [cyan]+10M[/], [cyan]-1K[/], [cyan]512[/]).
[green]--mtime <[+|-]Nd>[/]       Filter by modification time in days (e.g., [cyan]-7d[/], [cyan]+30d[/]).
[green]--owner <user>[/]         Filter by file owner username (e.g., 'root').
[green]--perms <octal>[/]        Filter by exact octal permissions (e.g., '755').
[bold]By Content & Name:[/b]
[green]--content <regex>[/]      Search [bold]inside[/] file contents for a regex match.
[green]-e, --ext <extension>[/]     Filter by file extension (e.g., 'py', 'log').
[green]-i, --ignore-case[/]        Enable case-insensitive matching for filenames.
[green]-m, --max-depth <N>[/]       Limit search to N levels deep (-1 for unlimited).
[green]--exclude <dir>[/]        Exclude a directory by name (can be used multiple times).
[green]--no-hidden[/]             [dim](Default)[/] Ignore hidden files and directories (names starting with '.').
[green]-s, --show-hidden[/]      Include hidden files and directories in the search.
[green]--ignore-vcs[/]            [dim](Default)[/] Automatically ignore files from VCS ignore files (e.g., .gitignore).
[green]--no-ignore[/]             Disable all ignore-file logic.
[green]--exec <cmd>[/]             Execute a command on each result. Use [cyan]{}[/] for the path.
[green]--delete[/]                [bold red]Permanently delete[/] found files and directories.
[green]--interactive[/]           Prompt for confirmation before each deletion when using [cyan]--delete[/].
[bold]Output Formatting:[/b]
[green]-l, --long-listing[/]       Use a detailed, 'ls -l' like listing format.
[green]--with-line-number[/]    Show line numbers when using [cyan]--content[/].
[green]--format <text|json|csv>[/] Change the output format (default: text).
[green]-o, --output <file>[/]       Write output to a file instead of stdout.
[green]--threads <N>[/]            Set the number of worker threads (default: number of CPU cores).
[green]-v, --version[/]            Show the tool's version number.
[green]-h, --help[/]               Show this help message.
[#] Find all Python files modified in the last 7 days, larger than 1KB:
[yellow]fastfind[/] [cyan].[/] [green]-p '\.py$' --mtime -7d --size +1K[/]
[#] Find all images and execute 'convert' on them in parallel:
[yellow]fastfind[/] [cyan]~/Pictures[/] [green]-p '\.(jpg|png)$' -i --exec 'convert {} -quality 80 resized/{}'[/]
[#] Find all log files containing the word 'ERROR' (case-insensitive) and show line numbers:
[yellow]fastfind[/] [cyan]/var/log[/] [green]-e log --content 'ERROR' -i --with-line-number[/]
[#] Interactively delete all '.tmp' files in the current directory:
[yellow]fastfind[/] [cyan].[/] [green]-p '\.tmp$' --delete --interactive[/]
[#] Export a CSV list of all directories, excluding 'node_modules':
[yellow]fastfind[/] [cyan].[/] [green]-p '.*' -t d --exclude node_modules --format csv -o dirs.csv[/]

â€¢ [bold]"Permission denied":[/] The tool does not have read access to a directory. Try running with 'sudo'.
